name: Koń
summary: The Horse (1967) was a wide-screen spectacle; it conveyed a never-ending energetic variation of galloping with constant changes of mobile brush strokes. The feeling of excitement in the dashing animals was immediately transmitted to the audience and the experience proved unforgettable. It won a prize at the Cracow Film Festival "for its exceptionally interesting animation technique".
